Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate I: 17th Century German helmet
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A German helmet of the period. b. Motifs---Italian scroll, rayed sun, human figures, animal and plant forms, vegetable flower forms. Acanthus, vines, grape, laurel leaves. It was the beginnings of the Baroque Period. c. Colors---All types and kinds, rich and heavy. d. Cosmetics---patches, wigs, masques, scent, paint, rouge, perfumes. e. Textiles---velvet, brocade, armures, damasks, satin, cloth of gold, printed linen, brocatelles, painted linen, petit point, rep, India prints, fustian, lace with gold and silver threads.
Image Rights#1: This Item is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use this Item in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s). URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC/1.0/

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate I: Egyptian crown
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A pahent, ornamented with the royal asp---worn by the pharaoh of Egypt. b. Motifs---sun, the beetle, the cobra, feathers, papyrus buds and reeds, lotus, date-palms, the lily, zigzags, herbs, animals, fan, nude figures, winged human figures, human faces, the ram, the cow, sparrow hawk, sacred tree and winged globe. c. Colors---gold and brilliant colors as yellow, red, and black; red, blue, and white; dark red, yellow, and blue. The triad form was popular. d. Cosmetics---oils and scent, stibium, a stain for eyelids and eyebrows. Kohl was used for the same purpose. Rouge and lip rouge was used. e. Textiles---wool, linen, cotton
Image Rights#1: This Item is protected by copyright and/or related rights. Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate I: Late Middle Ages German helmet
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A helmet of the type worn by German soldiers about 1450. b. Motifs---religious symbols, floriation, circles, arches, triangles, curves, pointed arch, heraldic forms, badges, crests, shields, acanthus, laurel, wreathes, anthemion and fleur-de-lis, crowns and urns. c. Colors---they became darker and richer. d. Cosmetics---white paint, vermilion, rouge, scent. e. Textiles---samite, cendal, pers, camelin, isambrun, 'moleskin' (a linen cloth), fustaine, serge, linen, cotton, wool, brocade, brocatelle, velvet.

Work Title#1: Plate II: 17th Century French coiffures
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---hair cut short and curled in ringlets partly concealed by a transparent veil embroidered with gold thread. About 1668. b. French---hair cut short and curled. c. French---hair a la garcon, a horizontal parting made along the forehead and a few loose curls fell over the brow. About 1650.

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate II: 17th Century French wig, hat, wig
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---periwig with flat crowned hat and turned up brim. Profusion of plumes encircled the crown. A minute mustache. About 1660. b. French---broad brimmed hats, variously cocked, trimmed with a plume. Usually of the traveling type. About 1670. c. French---a very artificial periwig with a ponderous arrangement of formal corkscrew curls. Broad brimmed hat cocked and edged with ostrich fringe. About 1679.

Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department

German--a lady in waiting. Hair parted in the center and drawn across the temples and falling to the shoulders. Back hair is bound in braids. Simple circlet of pearls.

Work Title#1: Plate IX: 18th Century French coiffure, headdress, coiffure
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---hair dressed close to the head and piled high, surmounted with a tiara of gold and jewels. About 1702. b. French---a Fontage-commode or tower; a close cap of lawn or lace, covering the back of the head and rising in front in several tall wired and goffered tiers, increasing in height from front to back and projecting obliquely forward. About 1693-1700. c. French---hair dressed close to the head in carefully arranged curls; crowned with jeweled pins and ribbons. About 1707.

Work Title#1: Plate V: 17th Century German hat, cap, scarf
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate V: Grecian headdress
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A youth with the lighter hair which was more desirable than the darker shades. Yellow, red, or auburn hair was ideal. b. Motifs---frets, meander, anthemion. Plant and animal forms, laurel, acanthus, bay, and grape leaves. Human figures and faces. c. Colors--- white and gold, saffron, green, yellow, red, and blue. Purple was worn more often by men. Black and purple was also a sign of grief or mourning. d. Cosmetics---white lead, rouge, scent and oils, honey wax, false hair, hair bleach. e. Textiles---skins, furs, felt, linen, wool, leather, and silk. There is no record that cotton was used. Embroidery was used in the form of bands on garments.

Flowing hair bound with cord of striped fabric. 1300. c. German---a wealthy gentleman. Headdress of the turban type, bound and draped with loose end falling over the shoulder. About 1375.

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate VIII: 18th Century Prussian helmet
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A Prussian helmet of the period. b. Motifs---It is the period of the Rococo. The soft undulating and sensuous curved line is in vogue. The shell is the outstanding motif. All types of naturalistic vegetable flower and animal forms are used. Ribbons, garlands, bows, fronds. The Chinese is in fashion. c. Colors---They are light and gay. Soft blues, green-blues, blue-greens, shell pink, citron, putty tones, buff, cream, white, god. d. Cosmetics---powder, rouge, scent, pomades, patches, false hair, unguents. e. Textiles---velvet, brocade, armures, damasks, satin, lace, cloth of gold, embroideries, toile de Jouy, brocatelles, petit point, rep, calico.

Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---fan shaped headdress of a simple horned hennin type with a long tail encasing the hair. About 1460-80. b. French---a lady of rank with unusual hat-like headdress, oriental in origin. About 1480. c. French---a lady of rank with a close cap of metallic cloth and scalloped or foliated hood draped about the head. About 1450-80.

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate VIII: Roman helmet
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A type of helmet worn by a high official in the Roman army. b. Motifs---honeysuckle, acanthus, laurel, rose, pineapple, vine, palm, ivy, poppy, winged dolphins, winged horses, garlands, fruits, masks, human and divine figures. c. Colors---purple and gold reserved for those of noble rank and victorious generals and emperor. Purple strip for men of rank. Blue, black, green, white, silver, gray and tan. d. Cosmetics---white lead, vermilion, oils and scent, soot was used for eyelids and eyebrows. The patch was also used. False hair. e. Textiles---skins, furs, felt, linen wool, much silk and leather. Cotton was used but for household purposes. Embroider was used with much gold and silver thread.

Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---hat of the rustic type as worn by Marie Antoinette. About 1787. b. French---elaborate hat, trimmed with plumes and pearls, perched on a fantastic wig of the period, powdered. About 1776-80. c. French---hair dressed very high and padded with cotton wool and masses of false hair. Kerchief trimmed with lace and flowers, powdered. About 1778-80.

Work Title#1: Plate X: Late Middle Ages English hennin; little, heart, horned
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. English---Heart shaped hennin with skull cap of quilted fabric. A veil falls down the back and is of fine material. About 1400-50. b. English---The little hennin with a short conical cap. It fits close to the head and is covered with fabric and trailing veils of fine fabric. c. English---The horned hennin or escoffion. A two horned arrangement about 30 inches wide made of fine lawn, starched and wired.

Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A type of helmet worn during the bronze age. b. Motifs---stripes, circles, dots, zigzags, lines, diamond and plaid squares, rope and plaited patterns. c. Work Title#1: Plate XI: Late Middle Ages English hats
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. English---a low brimmed hat without a crown. A crown is fashioned by a scarf drawn up thru the brim and draped around the shoulders. About [1000-1300]. b. English---a top-like hat but belled at the top, decorated with a gold clip. c. English---a gentleman of rank with a rolled brim, crown low and scarf draped around brim and falling over the shoulders.

Work Title#1: Plate XII: 18th Century French hood, coiffure, hat
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate XII: Early Western Europe cap, coiffure
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. A headdress of the type during the Bronze Age, consisting of a cap of fur or coarse felt. The hair was unkept and falling to the shoulders. b. Coiffure---early Christian; hair cut from the back of the head, the remainder was tied up in a tuft on the top, plaited or pinned up with wood, bone, or bronze ornaments. c. Coiffure---3rd and 4th centuries. It changed from a rugged mass of hair and became well combed and trimmed square across the neck.

Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department

Work Title#1: Plate XIV: 18th Century French wigs

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate XVI: Dark and Early Middle Ages crown, headdress, coiffure
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. Hair rolled or plaited and arranged at the sides of the head and covering the ears. The hair is confined in a net or crestine of gold and pearls. A crown surmounts the head. It is typical of the headdress worn by Byzantine nobility about the 9th and 10th centuries. b. Hair drawn simply to the sides and over the ears. A tuft on top is encircled by a band and covered by a veil. c. Hair is bound with bands of silk fabric in the fashion so popular in Byzantium.

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate XVII: 19th Century French helmet
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---a helmet of the period. b. Motifs---The period opens with a classical revival and we find the motifs of this period inspired by the Greek, Roman, and Pompeian periods. Later the movement is Victorian with a general revival of all that is period. c. Colors---they were varied and ranged from light delicate things to rich and heavy colors. d. Cosmetics---Early in the period the usual cosmetics were used by with the coming of Victoria into her power, scent of a delicate nature and just a dusting of rice powder was considered permissible. e. Textiles---velvet, brocade, armures, damasks, cloth of gold, toile de Jouy, Brocatelles, chintz, linen, dimity, cretonne, lawn, cashmere, crepe, cambric and tulle.

Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---high hat with straight brim, ostrich plume. About 1560. b. French---toque worn at the back of the head with a tiny rolled brim. About 1580. c. French---cap of Spanish origin

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate XXII: 19th Century French bonnet, coiffure, hat
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---bonnet with straight poke, edged with frill, with large ostrich plume. About 1840-50. b. French---hair parted in the center with plaits and side curls. Plait gradually is set lower to the back. About 1840-50. c. French---hat of silk with lower crown, very curved and pitched brim. Trimmed with ostrich tips. About 1828-36.

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate XXIII: 16th Century French bonnet, bonnet, coiffure
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---low bonnet with beret-like crown, upturned brim. A single plume follows the edge of the brim. Associated with Francis I. About 1515-50. b. French---bonnet with soft crown and turned down brim. Ostrich tip. About 1518-62. c. French---closely cropped hair of the period.

Collection Name#1: Clifford P. Westermeier Portfolio of Illustrations of Historical Hats and Headdresses
Work Title#1: Plate XXIII: 19th Century French hat, hat, coiffure
Location Name#1: University of Colorado at Boulder Special Collections Department
Work Description#1: a. French---high hat is the favorite. 1837-50. b. French---Chapeau Bras is getting smaller in size. c. French---hair parted at one side or curled tightly a la fashion and worn rather long. Later parted in the center and flattened on the forehead. Side whiskers eventually developed into a full beard around the chin.
